title: Education and Work Experience
text:
I received my undergraduate degree from Hamilton College in sociology with a minor in education. I then obtained my Masters degree from Simmons College in Special Education in 2011.
I have worked in school-based settings for the last 15 years. Through working as a one-on-one aide, a classroom teacher, and a learning specialist, I have learned that each child requires unique and personalized assistance. I am excited to bring the skills that I have gained through my previous work experiences to working with your child.

title: Services and Contact
text:
I work with individual children and small groups for tutoring and executive functioning coaching in Lower Manhattan and many areas of Downtown Brooklyn. I am also familiar with the process of obtaining evaluations for children, and working with parents to guide them through the process of developing an IEP and accommodation plan for their child.
I believe that the best way for children to learn is through in-person interactions and, therefore, I am not taking on virtual clients at this time.
To learn more about how I can help you and your children, as well as my rates, packages, and options, please contact me by email amanda dot iturbe at gmail dot com. I am happy to setup a 15 minute phone or zoom consultation call to discuss what options are best for you and your child.

title: Amanda Iturbe
text:
I am a New York City-based educator and learning specialist with over 15 years experience helping children reach their full potential. I specialize in helping upper-elementary, middle, and high school children with subject area content - including math and science - and organization skills, time management, and executive functioning.
Whether your child has an official diagnosis, IEP, support plan, or not, I am able to both tutor your child and set up a homework routine for when I am not present. I can also provide you with guidance as to what official accommodations may be appropriate for your child at school. I have helped numerous children obtain evaluations, and worked to get the results of those evaluations translated into actionable strategies that result in the child’s success.
